contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Zygfryd Blaut''' (March 2, 1943 in [[Gogolin]] – April 20, 2005) was a [[Poland|Polish]] [[football (soccer)|football]] player who won two titles with [[Legia Warsaw]]. He also played in one international match for [[Poland national football team|Poland]], against [[Iraq national football team|Iraq]]. His older brother [[Bernard Blaut|Bernard]] died on May 19, 2007. He had his most successful spell with Legia Warsaw between 1969–73, winning a Polish cup. During a tour of [[Spain]] and South America in 1971-72 he sustained an injury which severely hampered his progress. {{Odra Opole managers}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Blaut, Zygfryd | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Polish footballer | DATE OF BIRTH = March 2, 1943 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Gogolin | DATE OF DEATH = April 20, 2005 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Blaut, Zygfryd}} [[Category:Legia Warsaw players]] [[Category:Polish footballers]] [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:2005 deaths]] [[Category:Poland international footballers]] [[Category:Place of death missing]] [[Category:People from Gogolin]] [[Category:Polish football managers]] [[Category:Odra Opole managers]] {{Poland-footy-bio-stub}}
